definition: a hundred answers to a single call (idiom)/to respond en masse
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
surname Ying
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: In the end, John can become the kind of leader people will follow.
sentences.chinese: 约翰最终会成为一呼百应的领导。

definition: to issue a call for action/to raise one's hand and issue a rousing call (idiom)
to make a clarion call/to make a public appeal
one command brings a hundred responses (idiom); having hundreds of attendants at one's beck and call
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
to be in a position of power
to give one's allegiance/(popular) support
one word worth nine sacred tripods (idiom); words of enormous weight
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
to have the power to rally supporters
to endorse/to support
When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
prestige
to be of one mind/to work as one
to say one and mean just that (idiom); to keep one's word
